unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Momentum in Maharashtra**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Momentum in Maharashtra**

unnormalised: Mumbai, Oct 26 – Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd. (MSEDCL) has announced significant progress in its smart meter deployment initiative across the state. The project, aimed at modernizing the electricity distribution network, is expected to enhance billing accuracy and reduce power theft.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six – Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (M S E D C L) has announced significant progress in its smart meter deployment initiative across the state. The project, aimed at modernizing the electricity distribution network, is expected to enhance billing accuracy and reduce power theft.

unnormalised: As of today, over 5 lakh smart meters have been installed, primarily in urban areas like Pune and Nagpur. MSEDCL officials confirmed that the deadline for complete rollout in Mumbai Metropolitan Region is 31/12/2024. The initiative is partially funded by a central government scheme, with an estimated cost of Rs. 1,200 crore for Phase 1.
normalised: As of today, over five lakh smart meters have been installed, primarily in urban areas like Pune and Nagpur. M S E D C L officials confirmed that the deadline for complete rollout in Mumbai Metropolitan Region is thirty first december two thousand and twenty four. The initiative is partially funded by a central government scheme, with an estimated cost of rupee one thousand two hundred crore for Phase one.

unnormalised: "Smart meters empower consumers with real-time data, leading to better energy management," stated Mr. Sharma, Chairman of MSEDCL, during a press briefing at 11:00 hrs. on 25/10/2023. Plans are also underway to integrate the smart meter data with the state's grid management system, aiming for improved grid stability. The next phase will focus on rural electrification, commencing 15/11/2023, covering areas beyond 50 km from district headquarters. This is envisioned to help reduce the 'bijli chori' (electricity theft) problem common in some regions.
normalised: "Smart meters empower consumers with real time data, leading to better energy management," stated Mister Sharma, Chairman of M S E D C L, during a press briefing at eleven zero zero hours. on twenty fifth october two thousand and twenty three. Plans are also underway to integrate the smart meter data with the state's grid management system, aiming for improved grid stability. The next phase will focus on rural electrification, commencing fifteenth november two thousand and twenty three, covering areas beyond fifty kilometer from district headquarters. This is envisioned to help reduce the 'bijli chori' (electricity theft) problem common in some regions.
